problem_name: Behavior Change Intervention for Asthma Management
description: This problem involves developing strategies to change patient behaviors related to asthma management, particularly focusing on reducing reliance on short-acting beta-agonists (SABAs). Effective interventions can help patients understand their condition better and manage it more effectively.
you_have_this_if: Patients frequently use their rescue inhalers (SABAs) for symptom relief.
Patients report feeling anxious about their asthma symptoms.
Healthcare providers notice a lack of adherence to preventive asthma medications.
Patients express confusion about their asthma management plan.
There is a high number of emergency room visits related to asthma exacerbations.

approaches.best_for: When patients exhibit high reliance on SABA for asthma management and require education on the risks of overuse.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach may require significant patient engagement but can lead to better long-term management of asthma.

decision_matrix.best_when: Patients are over-relying on rescue inhalers and need structured education on asthma management.

start_here: The Reliever Reliance Test (RRT) is recommended as the first approach for addressing high reliance on SABAs, as it provides a structured framework for patient education and engagement.
